definition: corrective influence/to reform (a criminal)/redemption (of a sinner)/to influence (a malefactor to a better life)/to guide sb back to the right path by repeated word and example
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
variant of 花[hua1]
reformatory/reform school

sentences.english: Through the 7 times catches and 7 times releases, Meng Huo was finally influenced.
sentences.chinese: 通過對孟獲的七擒七放，終於感化了孟獲。

sentences.english: If you please, I should like to commute the preaching.
sentences.chinese: 如果您願意，我會在感化院宣講。

sentences.english: Try to influence the person who has prejudice about you or the person who ever bluffed you.
sentences.chinese: 適當的去感化對你有偏見的人，抑或是欺騙過你的人。

sentences.english: I did not expect to be detained by the KMT in Xi'an, held in Xi'an reformatory.
sentences.chinese: 沒想到在西安關卡被國民黨扣留，關押在西安感化院。

sentences.english: The self-help workshop was very touchy-feely, and made me fell uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 自助車間太過於情感化，使我感覺很不自在。

sentences.english: Music can reform heart of beast.
Ledger accounts are used to record business transactions'effect on an accounting entity.
sentences.chinese: 分類帳戶被用來記錄交易對管帳主體的感化。

sentences.english: You will be reclaimed and formed.
sentences.chinese: 你將要受到感化與改造。

sentences.english: It is not used by yeasts during the fermentation process and contributes to the palate fullness of ciders (Pollard et al. , 1966).
sentences.chinese: 在發酵過程中沒酵母感化並奉獻在蘋果汁地口胃上。

sentences.english: I hereby sentence you one year at a correctional facility .
sentences.chinese: 我特此宣判你在感化院呆一年。

sentences.english: Business card printing and membership card making color alignment on the superimposition of the effect is very large.
sentences.chinese: 制卡和會員卡制息色序擺列差疊印色成果感化很不小。

sentences.english: After my arrest, I was sent to a reformatory where I was taught to work - washing clothes, cooking, knitting.
sentences.chinese: 抓了去，他們把我放在了感化院，有人教給我作工。

sentences.english: Acrylon the elasticity of the fabric and bulkiness have direct impact on a production style.
sentences.chinese: 腈綸織物的不塑性和膨鬆性會間接感化製品品格。

sentences.english: Well, why don't you use your divine influence and get us out of this?
sentences.chinese: 那你何不用你神聖的感化力把我們弄出去？

sentences.english: Children and youth need the influence of a cheerful example.
sentences.chinese: 兒童與青年需要愉快榜樣的感化力。

sentences.english: But emotional design has not reached the field of business card design.
sentences.chinese: 但情感化設計理念用於名片藝術設計的研究還很少。

definition: to renounce evil and turn to virtue (idiom)
to enlighten/to civilize/to indoctrinate/to train (an animal)
to move and appeal/to rally to a cause/to impel/to inspire
to mend one's ways (idiom)/to turn over a new leaf
to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
to advise
to repent
to reason with sb/to lecture
to talk sb round/to straighten sth out/to enlighten
to preach
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to instruct/to teach/guidance/teaching
magic transformation performed by Daoist immortal/fig. to reveal/to enlighten
turn away from evil and follow virtue
to have a heart of stone/hard-hearted/unfeeling
to regret/to repent
